snippet: Doctors treating Ms. Rivers did not notice her deteriorating vital signs for about 15 minutes before she went into cardiac arrest, a report said.
abstract: Federal investigation finds that Yorkville Endoscopy, Manhattan clinic treating Joan Rivers in August, did not notice that her vital signs were deteriorating for at least 15 minutes before she went into cardiac arrest, leading to her death several days later, also reports that Dr Lawrence Cohen, then medical director of clinic, took cellphone pictures of Rivers while she was unconscious from anesthesia.
lead_paragraph: Doctors treating Ms. Rivers did not notice her deteriorating vital signs for about 15 minutes before she went into cardiac arrest, a report said.

headline.main: Joan Rivers’s Treatment Had Numerous Violations, U.S. Inquiry Finds
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Uncovers Numerous Violations During Rivers’s Treatment

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations
